Getting Started¶

Installing¶

Using pip:

pip install git+https://github.com/PteroPackages/Pytero.git

From Sources:

git clone https://github.com/PteroPackages/Pytero.git

Structure¶

All of Pytero’s API methods are asynchronous and make use of futures which makes use of the native asyncio library to run async programs. If you do not want to use asynchronous code for your program, we recommend using the Pydactyl API wrapper.

Application API¶

First, import the PteroApp class in your file, this holds all the functions for interacting with the application API. Make sure to also import the asyncio library (we will need this later).

import asyncio
from pytero import PteroApp

The class takes 2 values for initializing: your Pterodactyl panel URL, and your API key. This supports the use of both application keys and client keys, but we recommend that you use a client key as application keys are deprecated.

app = PteroApp('https://your.pterodactyl.domain', 'ptlc_Your_4pi_k3y')

Next, define a main function to run your program, in this example we will be fetching all users from the API.

async def main():
    users = await app.get_users()
    for user in users:
        print(repr(user))

The PteroApp method naming convention is designed to be straightforward: all fetch_ or get_ methods will fetch a specific resource, all set_ or update_ will update a specific resource, all delete_ or remove_ methods will delete a specific resource, and so on. These methods are also documented in the API Reference.

Finally, run your program with the asyncio.run() method. It’s good practice to wrap the call in a name check like below, but you can omit it for this program if you want.

if __name__ == '__main__':
    asyncio.run(main())

If you’ve done this correctly, you should see a list of User objects in repr form printed to the console:

<User id=1 uuid=d5aa40ee-8e7f-4af5-af72-420ea383c432>
<User id=2 uuid=66fdb4ae-2ff8-4467-95e0-65d613d11da4>
<User id=4 uuid=e9d12be2-7bfb-419d-8888-3958a71c5cac>

The full program:

import asyncio
from pytero import PteroApp

app = PteroApp('https://your.pterodactyl.domain', 'ptlc_Your_4pi_k3y')

async def main():
    users = await app.get_users()
    for user in users:
        print(repr(user))


if __name__ == '__main__':
    asyncio.run(main())

Next Steps¶

Well done for completing this guide! Feel free to take a look at the Advanced section for more advanced usage of the package and API, or the API Reference for more information about the library.
